title: How to Put Libby Books on a Kindle Paperwhite, Scribe, & More

steps.title: Log in to Libby.
steps.content: Log in to Libby. You can do this on your phone, computer, or even on your Kindle (jump ahead for our Kindle instructions ). To get a Libby book on your Kindle, your Kindle must have an internet connection. If your Kindle can't connect to Wi-Fi, you won't be able to get a Libby book on your Kindle device. However, you can still get it delivered to your Kindle app or Kindle for the Web.

steps.title: Click or tap the shelf icon.
steps.content: Click or tap the shelf icon. This icon looks like a stack of books.

steps.title: Click or tap Loans.
steps.content: Click or tap Loans . It's at the top of the screen, above the Holds option. If you don't currently have any loans, click the magnifying glass icon at the bottom of the screen and search for a book you'd like to borrow, then click or tap Borrow next to the book.

steps.title: Click or tap Read With Kindle.
steps.content: Click or tap Read With Kindle . The button will be under the book's title.

steps.title: Sign in with Amazon.
steps.content: Sign in with Amazon. If your Kindle is not connected to your Amazon account, you must connect it before proceeding. If your Kindle is brand new, simply plug it in and go through the first-time setupâ€”the Kindle will ask you to register the device to your Amazon account. If the Kindle is not new and is registered to a different Amazon account: Open your Kindle's settings and tap on Your account . Tap Deregister device and then re-register your Kindle under the correct Amazon account.

steps.title: Click or tap Get Library Book.
steps.content: Click or tap Get Library Book . The Libby book is now connected to your Amazon account, and you can access it on your Kindle device, in the Kindle app, or in Kindle for Web. The book will be in your library with the rest of your ebooks. [1] X Research source Kindle device: Once your Amazon account syncs with your Kindle, the book will be available to read. To speed up this process, open your Kindle and swipe down from the top of the screen, then tap Sync . Kindle app: The book is immediately available on your Kindle app for reading. Kindle for Web: After clicking Get Library Book , click or tap Read now in Kindle for Web to immediately open the Libby book in your web browser.

steps.title: Tap the three-dot icon on your Kindle home screen.
steps.content: Tap the three-dot icon on your Kindle home screen. It's in the upper-right corner. Kindle e-readers can't install the Libby app, as they're not actual tablets. Though often called a "Kindle Fire," the Amazon Fire tablet is not the same as a Kindle e-reader. Like most tablets, the Amazon Fire tablet can get the Libby app.

steps.title: Tap Web Browser.
steps.content: Tap Web Browser . Despite being an e-reader, the Kindle has a basic web browser that can be used for simple tasks (such as logging in to Libby).

steps.title: Go to [2] X Research source .
steps.content: Go to [2] X Research source . Note that the Kindle web browser is much slower than the browser on your computer or phone. Only use the Kindle web browser if you're not able to use a different type of web browser or the Libby app on your phone or tablet.

steps.title: Borrow books and send them to your Kindle.
steps.content: Borrow books and send them to your Kindle. You can use the steps in the first section of this article to send Libby books to your Kindle.

steps.title: Can I transfer Libby books to my Kindle via USB?
steps.content: Can I transfer Libby books to my Kindle via USB? No, you can no longer transfer Libby books to your Kindle with a USB cable. USB transfer support ended in February of 2025. [3] X Research source Now you must use Wi-Fi to send Libby books to your Kindle, Kindle app, or Kindle for the Web.

steps.title: Can I get the Libby app on my Kindle?
steps.content: Can I get the Libby app on my Kindle? No, you cannot get the Libby app on your Kindle. Kindles do not allow you to install apps, as they're just e-readers. You can, however, go to Libby's website using the Kindle browser . Many users assume Kindles can download apps because Amazon's tablet, the Fire, is sometimes called a "Kindle Fire." However, Kindle e-readers and Fire tablets are not the same. Fire tablets can install the Libby app. You can also send a Libby book to your Amazon Kindle account and open it on the Amazon Kindle app on your Fire tablet if you prefer. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Why won't Libby let me read with my Kindle?
steps.content: Why won't Libby let me read with my Kindle? There are a few reasons Libby might not let you send a book to your Kindle: [5] X Research source The book might not be available on Kindle. You can see if a book is available for Kindle by tapping the book cover and scrolling down to the "Read With" section. You might already have the book in another format. If you've already borrowed the book in a different format on Libby or your library's OverDrive, you can't send it to Kindle, and you must re-borrow the book from Libby to send it. Your Libby reading preference might be set to the Libby app. To change this, tap the three-line menu button in Libby and choose Read Books Withâ€¦ > Kindle .
